name: Shurpa
description: A hearty and warming soup traditionally made with lamb and a variety of root vegetables, enriched with fresh herbs and spices, making it a staple during Turkmen winters.
steps: In a large pot, brown the lamb pieces to develop flavor.
Add water and bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that forms on the surface.
Add chopped potatoes, carrots, onions, and bell peppers to the pot.
Season with salt, pepper, and a bouquet garni of local herbs.
Simmer gently until the meat is tender and vegetables are cooked.
Serve hot, sprinkled with chopped herbs like dill and parsley.
tips: The key to a clear broth is to thoroughly skim the foam from the top of the pot during the initial boiling.
Adding a small amount of vinegar or lemon juice helps in extracting flavor from the bones if using bone-in lamb.
Adjust the variety and quantity of vegetables according to seasonal availability.
